thread.title: IEEE Cleveland Section launches Cleveland Entrepreneurs Network with Strategic Partnerships - What it Takes to Form a Winning Alliance
thread.title_full: IEEE Cleveland Section launches the Cleveland Entrepreneurs Network with Strategic Partnerships - What it Takes to Form a Winning Alliance

author: Charles Andrew Hayes
title: IEEE Cleveland Section launches Cleveland Entrepreneurs Network with Strategic Partnerships - What it Takes to Form a Winning Alliance
text:
The IEEE Cleveland Section is pleased to announce the launching of the Cleveland Entrepreneurs Network. The goal of the Network is to connect early stage entrepreneurs with information and resources necessary to transform an idea into a successful product or service business. The Network aims to accomplish this goal by providing a venue for meeting participants and members to network, talk about their ideas, showcase their startups, and conduct business. The Bright Ideas Networking Series will be the first event series hosted by the Cleveland Entrepreneurs Network at the Ohio Aerospace Institute in Cleveland, Ohio. The first event of the series will be Strategic Partnerships - What it Takes to Form a Winning Alliance , and will be presented in partnership with Wegman, Hessler & Vanderburg ( http://www.wegmanlaw.com ). This first event will take place at 5:30PM on Thursday, October 22, 2015.
Three entrepreneurs and regional business leaders will be joining us at the event to share their insights on strategic partnerships/alliances, along with their successes and learning’s along the way. The format for the program will be fast-paced, highly-interactive and will include representatives from:
 USA Firmware – Bob Scaccia Panel Master – Ridley Watts Bird Technologies Group, Inc.
The IEEE Cleveland Section looks forward to a strong showing at the Bright Ideas Networking Series.
Seating is limited and can be secured by the requested RSVP date of October 19 at the Events section of http://www.clevelandieee.org .
Food and drink will be provided to attendees. 2 hours of PDH credits will be available for Ohio Professional Engineers.
About IEEE Cleveland Section
IEEE is the world’s largest technical professional society. Through its more than 375,000 members in 160 countries, IEEE is a leading authority on a wide variety of areas ranging from aerospace systems, computers and telecommunications to biomedical engineering, electric power and consumer electronics. The Cleveland Section, chaired by Charles Andrew Hayes, is the Cleveland, Ohio based regional organizational unit of IEEE. Charles Andrew Hayes is a registered patent and trademark attorney at Wegman, Hessler & Vanderburg. http://www.clevelandieee.org
About Wegman, Hessler & Vanderburg
The men and women at Cleveland, Ohio, based Wegman, Hessler & Vanderburg have been meeting the legal needs of individuals, organizations and businesses since 1968. We are committed to excellence and to being responsive to our clients’ needs which, in turn, has nurtured our development into a multi-talented and unique firm offering the skills and talents of our attorneys in a number of critical practice areas. At WH&V, it is our desire to devote the necessary legal resources to represent our clients in all areas of need – corporate structure, organization, mergers and acquisitions, succession planning, expansion, intellectual property, real estate, labor and employment, litigation, and asset protection. We also offer expertise in domestic relations, trust and estate administration, estate planning, guardianships and conservatorships. It has been our privilege to witness and share in the growth of a number of our clients and we enjoy the opportunity to serve a variety of non-profit organizations, thereby giving us an opportunity to share in their good work and give back to the communities we are privileged to serve. http://www.wegmanlaw.com
